Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.platonicsolid

Enum Class PlatonicSolid

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<PlatonicSolid>
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.platonicsolid.PlatonicSolid
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<PlatonicSolid>, Constable
public enum PlatonicSolid extends Enum<PlatonicSolid>

Definitions for the 5 Platonic solids: tetrahedron, cube, octahedron, icosahedron and dodecahedron. The tetrahexahedron is also defined even though it is not a platonic solid (it is a combination of a cube and an octahedron). For each polyhedron, the unit vectors of each of the verteces and the connectivity for each face are defined.

The geocentric distance between vertices, in degrees:

tetrahedron 109.471220634491
cube 70.528779365509
octahedron 90.000000000000
dodecahedron 41.810314895779
icosahedron 63.434948822922

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2008

Company: Sandia National Laboratories

  • Enum Constant Details

    • TETRAHEDRON

      public static final PlatonicSolid TETRAHEDRON
      Solid composed of 4 vertexes and 4 triangular faces.

      The geocentric distance between vertices, in degrees = 109.471220634491

    • CUBE

      public static final PlatonicSolid CUBE
      Solid composed of 8 vertexes and 6 square faces. All values are +/- 1/sqrt(3)

      The geocentric distance between vertices, in degrees = 70.528779365509

    • OCTAHEDRON

      public static final PlatonicSolid OCTAHEDRON
      Solid composed of 6 vertexes and 8 triangular faces.

      The geocentric distance between vertices, in degrees = 90.000000000000

    • ICOSAHEDRON

      public static final PlatonicSolid ICOSAHEDRON
      Solid composed of 12 vertexes and 20 triangular faces. The first and last points are the north and south poles, respectively. For all other points, the z-components are = +/- 1/sqrt(5)

      The geocentric distance between vertices, in degrees = 63.434948822922

    • DODECAHEDRON

      public static final PlatonicSolid DODECAHEDRON
      Solid composed of 20 vertexes and 12 pentagonal faces.

      The geocentric distance between vertices, in degrees = 41.810314895779

    • TETRAHEXAHEDRON

      public static final PlatonicSolid TETRAHEXAHEDRON
      Solid composed of 14 vertexes and 24 triangular faces. Start with a cube. Put a vertex in the middle of each face and split the face into 4 triangles. This is not a Platonic Solid but rather a combination of a cube and an octahedron.

    • getVertex

      public double[] getVertex​(int i, int j)
      Get the unit vector of the vertex that is the j'th vertex of the i'th face of the polyhedron. i ranges from 0 to nFaces and j ranges from 0 to nVertecesPerFace.
      Parameters:
      i - int
      j - int
      Returns:
      double[]

    • getFaces

      public int[][] getFaces()
      Retrieve the connectivity map for all the faces of the polyhedron.
      Returns:
      int[][] nFaces by nVerticesPerFace array of integers where the integers are the index of the vertex.

    • getFace

      public int[] getFace​(int i)
      Retrieve the connectivity of the i'th face fo the polyhedron.
      Parameters:
      i - int the index of the face for which the connectivity is desired.
      Returns:
      int[] the indeces of the verteces that comprise the i'th face. The length will be 3 for tetrahedron, 4 for cube, 3 for octahedron, 3 for icosahedron and 5 for dodecahedron.

    • getEdgeLength

      public double getEdgeLength​(int nSubdivisions)
      Retrieve the length of the first edge of the first face of the solid, in radians.
      Parameters:
      nSubdivisions - number of times actual edgelength should be divided in half.
      Returns:
      the length of the first edge of the first face of the solid, in radians.

      Parameters:
